rules.natural: Provided that the patient is abstinent from alcohol, it follows that the patient is not consuming alcohol.
Under the condition that the patient is monitored for progress, the patient is compliant with the treatment.
Either the patient is monitored for progress or the patient is evaluated for progress.
If the patient is evaluated for progress, then whenever the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.
The patient is attending sessions, or the patient is enrolled in therapy, or the patient is prescribed medication.
If the patient is dependent on a drug, then the patient is addicted to a drug.
Given that the patient is dependent on a drug, it is not the case that the patient is addicted to a drug.
Either the patient is dependent on a drug, or the patient is not attending sessions.
Either the patient is counseled by a therapist or the patient is supported by a group.
If the patient is supported by a group, then provided that the patient is tested as drug-free, the patient is not using a drug.
If it is not the case that being counseled by a therapist implies that if tested as drug-free then not using a drug, then the patient is discharged from the program.
If it is false that being counseled by a therapist entails that if tested as drug-free then not using a drug, then the patient is not discharged from the program.
If the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, then the patient has relapsed with alcohol.
In the event that the patient is not prescribed medication, then the patient is consuming alcohol.
If the patient is not prescribed medication, then the patient is using a drug.

facts.natural: The patient is tested as drug-free.
It is not the case that the patient is enrolled in therapy.
The patient is not compliant with the treatment.

steps.natural: The patient is not dependent on a drug.
The patient is not attending sessions.
Either the patient is enrolled in therapy or the patient is prescribed medication.
Under the condition that the patient is counseled by a therapist, if the patient is tested as drug-free, then the patient is not using a drug.
Whenever the patient is tested as drug-free, it follows that the patient is not using a drug.
The patient is not using a drug.
Either the patient is compliant with the treatment, or if the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, then the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.
Provided that the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, it follows that the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.
The patient is abstinent from alcohol.
The patient is not consuming alcohol.

natural_facts.A5: The patient is using a drug.

natural_facts.A8: The patient is supported by a group.
natural_facts.A9: The patient is discharged from the program.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the patient is enrolled in therapy or the patient is prescribed medication.

(A11 → ¬A10).natural: Provided that the patient is abstinent from alcohol, it follows that the patient is not consuming alcohol.

(A13 ∨ (¬A11 → ¬A12)).natural: Either the patient is compliant with the treatment, or if the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, then the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.

(A14 → A13).natural: Under the condition that the patient is monitored for progress, the patient is compliant with the treatment.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: Either the patient is monitored for progress or the patient is evaluated for progress.

(A15 → (¬A11 → ¬A12)).natural: If the patient is evaluated for progress, then whenever the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.

(A2 ∨ (A1 ∨ G)).natural: The patient is attending sessions, or the patient is enrolled in therapy, or the patient is prescribed medication.

(A3 → A4).natural: If the patient is dependent on a drug, then the patient is addicted to a drug.

(A3 → ¬A4).natural: Given that the patient is dependent on a drug, it is not the case that the patient is addicted to a drug.

(A3 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Either the patient is dependent on a drug, or the patient is not attending sessions.

(A6 → ¬A5).natural: Whenever the patient is tested as drug-free, it follows that the patient is not using a drug.

(A7 → (A6 → ¬A5)).natural: Under the condition that the patient is counseled by a therapist, if the patient is tested as drug-free, then the patient is not using a drug.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Either the patient is counseled by a therapist or the patient is supported by a group.

(A8 → (A6 → ¬A5)).natural: If the patient is supported by a group, then provided that the patient is tested as drug-free, the patient is not using a drug.

(¬(A7 → (A6 → ¬A5)) → A9).natural: If it is not the case that being counseled by a therapist implies that if tested as drug-free then not using a drug, then the patient is discharged from the program.

(¬(A7 → (A6 → ¬A5)) → ¬A9).natural: If it is false that being counseled by a therapist entails that if tested as drug-free then not using a drug, then the patient is not discharged from the program.

(¬A11 → A12).natural: If the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, then the patient has relapsed with alcohol.

(¬A11 → ¬A12).natural: Provided that the patient is not abstinent from alcohol, it follows that the patient has not relapsed with alcohol.

(¬G → A10).natural: In the event that the patient is not prescribed medication, then the patient is consuming alcohol.

(¬G → A5).natural: If the patient is not prescribed medication, then the patient is using a drug.

A11.natural: The patient is abstinent from alcohol.

A6.natural: The patient is tested as drug-free.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the patient is enrolled in therapy.

¬A10.natural: The patient is not consuming alcohol.

¬A13.natural: The patient is not compliant with the treatment.

¬A2.natural: The patient is not attending sessions.

¬A3.natural: The patient is not dependent on a drug.

¬A5.natural: The patient is not using a drug.
